newsitem.title: VENEZUELA: Venezuelan labor impasse show no sign of easing.
newsitem.headline: Venezuelan labor impasse show no sign of easing.

text.p: Venezuela's labor strife deepened on Thursday as the government stood firm in its offer of across-the-board 25 percent public-sector wage increases and insisted no sector should receive preferential treatment.
"We're looking for a global solution, not increases here and there, bit by bit," Planning Minister Teodoro Petkoff said in a television interview after meeting with union and business leaders.
University teachers, who walked off their jobs on Wednesday, are asking for a 125 percent pay raise. Doctors, who began striking December 27, want an average 300 percent increase.
